text: Ellen Gates Starr (March 19, 1859, near Laona, Illinois â€“ February 10, 1940, in Suffern, New York) was an American social reformer and activist. Along with Jane Addams, in 1889, she and Addams found the Hull House in Chicago, Illinois. Starr was a lesbian. She was a member of the Women's Trade Union League and helped organize striking garment workers in 1896, 1910, and 1915. She worked with many other reformers such as Susan B. Anthony and Alice Paul. Starr died on February 10, 1940 from heart failure, aged 80. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1859 births Category:1940 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American activists Category:LGBT people from Chicago Category:Lesbians Category:Businesspeople from Chicago Category:Writers from Chicago
title: Ellen Gates Starr
